Info.desc: Explains how to write the code for the Rest API and then run it.

Instructions.instruction: Now open a new terminal and run the following command. It will rename your project to be "spring-boot-h2"

Run the following commands to crate new folders/files in your project. Instead of using the "touch" commands, I'd recommend just right clicking on folders in VSCode and press "New file" for Java files. It will auto-generate packages and boiler-plate code for the file. I just included the "touch" commands because I thought they'd be convenient and I've included the necessary code below.

Code.FormatCode:
cd spring-boot-h2/src/main/java/com/springbackend/demo

mkdir config
mkdir controllers
mkdir models
mkdir repositories
mkdir services

touch config/WebConfig.java
touch config/H2ServerConfiguration.java
touch controllers/UserController.java
touch models/User.java
touch repositories/UserRepository.java
touch services/UserService.java

cd ~/spring-boot-h2

Instructions.instruction: This step is completely optional and I do NOT recommend doing it this way. But if you don't want your data to persist between sessions change the "spring.datasource.url" line in the "application.properties" file to be the following value. This will clear your table everytime you rerun your api. If you choose to do this, remember to use "jdbc:h2:mem:testdb" as your JDBC URL when you login to your h2-console later on.
In your terminal run the following commands. You could also change into "spring-boot-h2" then run "npm init" and fill in the prompts to create "package.json", but we'll keep it more simple for now.

Code.FormatCode:
cd ~
cd spring-boot-h2
touch package.json
touch start.sh
Code.CopyCode:

touch package.json
touch start.sh

Instructions.instruction: Now open your "start.sh" file in the top-most directory of your "spring-boot-h2" folder and paste in the following code.

Code.FormatCode:
#!/bin/sh
YELLOW='\033[0;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

stop_spring_boot() {
  echo "\n\n${YELLOW}Spring Boot application finished successfully!${NC}"
  kill "$SPRING_BOOT_PID"
}

trap stop_spring_boot INT TERM

mvn --quiet spring-boot:run &
SPRING_BOOT_PID=$!

sleep 0.1

echo "* Running on ${BLUE}http://localhost:8080${NC}\n"

wait "$SPRING_BOOT_PID"
Code.CopyCode:
